comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content:
She is the original actress in the timeless "As the actress said to the Bishop..." double entendre jokes.

The Bishop of Worcester and Lillie Langtry attended a  country house weekend party. On Sunday before church, the bishop and the actress went for a stroll in the garden. The bishop cut his finger on the thorn of a rose. Later in tyhe day ,over lunch, Miss Langtry asked the bishop brightly , "How is your pr**k My Lord?" He replied, "Throbbing," Evidently the footman  dropped the potatoes.

comment.author: 7332792@N03
comment._content:
Wonderful photograph.... I think I was born in the wrong era.....

I was going to fave it anyway... but after your historic revelation [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00], I wish I could make it x2...... :)

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: Yes, history was always my strong point

comment.author: 54243231@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/92943860@N00] Great story! Was this "Bertie's" influence? He was quite bawdy. 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anna_haworth] So true (about the wrong era)! I often feel this way. I hate corsets, though (wore one for my wedding). 
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/stewartcherlin] Very true about the detail! The wallpaper was probably Anaglypta or Lincrusta, embossed paper made to simulate plaster. It's had a renewed popularity, mostly in Victorian renovation and reproduction.

comment.author: 46415642@N02
comment._content:
I'm pretty sure this is the same woman whose pictures inspired The Who's song, "Pictures of Lily".  His dad gives him those photos which seem to help him to both sleep and fantasize.  From the lyrics... 

I Fell In Love With Lily
I Asked My Dad Where Lily I Could Find
He Said, 'Son, Now Don't Be Silly'

'She's Been Dead Since 1929'
Oh, How I Cried That Night
If Only I'd Been Born In Lily's Time
It Would Have Been Alright

find the lyrics.  Listen to the song.  It's quite fine.

comment.author: 54243231@N04
comment._content: Seemingly so. The dates track. But why would a guy do that to his son? I sense unresolved Oedipal issues!!
